FilePublisherRule.Name: All packaged apps
FilePublisherRule.Description: Allows members of the Everyone group to run packaged apps that are

FilePublisherRule.Name: Signed by O=INTEL CORPORATION, L=SANTA CLARA, S=CA, C=US

FilePublisherCondition.PublisherName: O=INTEL CORPORATION, L=SANTA CLARA, S=CA, C=US

FilePublisherRule.Name: Signed by O=RIOT GAMES, INC., L=LOS ANGELES, S=CALIFORNIA, C=US
FilePublisherRule.Description: Trojan virus. Internet rootkit. Try delete, but don't kill motherboard. Use power users to allow.

FilePublisherCondition.PublisherName: O=RIOT GAMES, INC., L=LOS ANGELES, S=CALIFORNIA, C=US

FilePublisherRule.Name: Signed by O=BITSUM TECHNOLOGIES (BITSUM LLC), L=MORRISTOWN, S=TENNESSEE, C=US

FilePublisherCondition.PublisherName: O=BITSUM TECHNOLOGIES (BITSUM LLC), L=MORRISTOWN, S=TENNESSEE, C=US

FilePublisherRule.Name: MICROSOFT速 WINDOWS速 OPERATING SYSTEM, from O=MICROSOFT CORPORATION, L=REDMOND, S=WASHINGTON, C=US
FilePublisherRule.Description: Deny is recommended. First party malware, but your system won't work if you deny, because out of box - all are only for power users and administrators. Safe as it gets while running.

FilePathRule.Name: *.dll
FilePathRule.Description: This is against malfunction, manipulation in compilation where codes execute autonomously. Great against incompatibility and INstable remotes.

FilePathRule.Name: %OSDRIVE%\Users\*\AppData\Local\Temp\*
FilePathRule.Description: This needs user account control disabled and start all as administrators just like you see on WINDOWS SERVER operating systems.
These are DPC (executables coming from service host process) like $logfile, $MFT, $index
